{
  "topic": "Puzzles involving generations and family tree logic",
  "question": "If 'A$B' means A is mother of B, 'A&B' means A is brother of B, 'A@B' means A is father of B, then which of the following is correct about J@K$M&N?",
  "choices": ["A) J is father of N", "B) M is brother of N", "C) K is mother of M", "D) N is son of J"],
  "answer": "D",
  "explanation": "Step 1: Decode symbols - J@K means J is father of K, K$M means K is mother of M, M&N means M is brother of N. Step 2: Analyze relationships - J is father of K, K is mother of M, M is brother of N. Step 3: Determine relationship - N is son of J. Therefore, D is correct."
}

{
  "topic": "Puzzles involving generations and family tree logic",
  "question": "In a family, A is the father of B. C is the daughter of B. D is the brother of C. E is the mother of D. F is the son of E. How is A related to F?",
  "choices": ["A) Father", "B) Grandfather", "C) Uncle", "D) Brother"],
  "answer": "B",
  "explanation": "A is father of B, B is parent of C and D, E is mother of D and F. A is grandfather of F. Therefore, A is F's grandfather."
}

{
  "topic": "Puzzles involving generations and family tree logic",
  "question": "In a family, A is the mother of B. B is the brother of C. C is the son of D. D is the father of E. How is E related to A?",
  "choices": ["A) Daughter", "B) Niece", "C) Granddaughter", "D) Grandson"],
  "answer": "C",
  "explanation": "Step 1: Identify relationships - A is mother of B, B is brother of C, C is son of D, D is father of E. Step 2: Build family tree - A→B→C, D→C→E. Step 3: Determine relationship - E is daughter of C, who is child of A. Therefore, E is granddaughter of A."
}

{
  "topic": "Truth-teller and Liar Problems",
  "question": "You meet two islanders, X and Y. X says, 'Y is a liar.' Y says, 'X and I are of the same type.' Who is who?",
  "choices": ["A) X is truth-teller, Y is liar", "B) X is liar, Y is truth-teller", "C) Both are truth-tellers", "D) Both are liars"],
  "answer": "D",
  "explanation": "If X is truth-teller, Y is liar (from X's statement). But Y's statement 'X and I are of same type' would be false, contradicting Y being a liar. If X is liar, Y is liar (X's statement is false). Y's statement 'X and I are of same type' is false, consistent with both being liars."
}

{
  "topic": "Seating Arrangements (Linear, Circular)",
  "question": "Six friends—A, B, C, D, E, and F—are sitting in a straight line facing north. A is sitting at one end. B is sitting second to the right of A. D is sitting between C and E. F is not sitting next to A. Who is sitting at the left end?",
  "choices": ["A) A", "B) B", "C) C", "D) D"],
  "answer": "A",
  "explanation": "A is at left end. B is second to right of A: A-_-B-_-_-_. D between C and E: C-D-E or E-D-C. F not next to A. Try C-D-E in positions 3-4-5: A-F-B-C-D-E. F not next to A ✓. Left end is A."
}
